text: the digital transformation hub is a
strategic relationship between Amazon
Web Services and Cal Poly our goal is to
be able to provide our students with
learn by doing activities and those can
be applied to public sector problems
through the latest in technologies and
also through innovation processes
brought to us through AWS nothing has
changed this world more than the cloud
so the ability of the DX hub to develop
a cloud learning evolutionary process is
what really prepares the students better
as they go to work in the world at large
it's putting students in a position to
solve real-world problems I am working
collaboratively with the DX hub for the
California Energy Commission on marine
focused technology that will hopefully
be able to identify marine species on
the ocean floor using artificial
intelligence
I see computing as at the service of a
lot of different disciplines at Cal Poly
especially in the area of agriculture
which has been historically technology
starved the application that we ended up
solidifying on for this summer was
tracking of cattle for ranchers in the
local area having a framework with the
Amazon experts and of course all the
technology that's available really
allows for rapid prototyping in a matter
of weeks or even months rather than
years you had to have that situation be
always online available from anywhere as
a real benefit for the research we went
into the hardest problem with the
incredible national message that is
burning hot right now our project
challenge was to work with ceilings
Police Department and working in
partnership with AWC Cal Poly to create
evidence based policing platform
projects that we've worked on here at
Cal Poly could translate well to a lot
of other institutions around the globe
it's really allowing them to give back
as they're learning being exposed to
public sector issues and working to
solve those issues with technology
solutions whether it be project
management or team building or resource
planning has provided with an
opportunity to gain experience that I
did not expect until much later in my
career that student now has in their
toolkit for life an innovative process
that is used by a billion-dollar company
innovating through the roof that is a
game changer for both the student the
company they work for
and society at large
